result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Toman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  The remaining fine to be paid within 90 days.  Failure to pay the Court orders 22 days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

Cash Bail Applied.  The remaining Surcharge to be paid within 90 days.  Failure to pay the Court orders 22 Days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Attorney Gebhard moves for return of the firearm.  Court grants the return of the firearm to the defendant or his Mother Karen T.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R Toman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel R Toman in court with attorney Karl Gebhard.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Gebhard makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: CT#1
FINE: $ 883.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 (To be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders 22 days Huber as contempt for non-compliance with Court Order).

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  

Attorney Gebhard moves for return of the firearm.  Court grants the return of the firearm to the defendant or his mother Karen T.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms except in the course of military duties.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant Daniel R Toman in court with attorney Karl Gebhard.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
